column4: run xev and see if the keys even trigger an event, if not youll need a driver that likely doesnt exist. as for the lcd, if it is generic you might be able to fiddle with it. the "applets" are not going to work without a native port or maybe wine(doubt it)
do you mean the G keys or the M keys or just regular keys?
or should i try them all?
tried pressing the M keys and they didn't work
just try them all and maybe copy the output(if any)
the regular keys get output; if i press 1 and hit G13 they get the EXACT same output
youll need a custom program to do that if they dont have drivers for linux
it could be done, but a dev would need access to the keyboard.. lookingg at the price, I doubt thats gonna happen
that's simply because it's me with the problem; i'm sure if it was someone else, it'd be a lot better simply because it isn't me and my bad luck
problems have been stacking up and nobody has helped me with any of them
your asking for something that doesnt exist, nobody will be able to help with that unless they are a developer and also have that keyboard
but my other problems aren't about HID stuff, and even then, nobody could help
like what? maybe try rephrasing the question
well, the other issue is HID
If nobody responds to your question, it doesnt mean they are ignoring you. either they dont know the answer or it doesnt interest them. there is also ##linux for more generic linux topics
sorry for being so blunt and rude, i'm just fed up
to the point of where i'm having second thoughts on installing ubuntu in the first place
